name: State_16

timeline_beats.label: Flux-era privateer wars and reef fortifications

factions.label: Maritime Guild
factions.influence_hint: dominant economic actor; controls long-distance ships and reagent imports

factions.label: Harbormasters Council
factions.influence_hint: administers ports, customs, local militias; high local authority

factions.label: Tide-Temples
factions.influence_hint: religious sway over sailors and navigation rituals

factions.label: Coastal Nobility
factions.influence_hint: landed elites controlling cliffs, fortresses, levy troops

traits: kinship networks tied to boats, not land
practical syncretism of ancestor rites and sea-animisms

constraints: No instant resurrection or true life-replacement magics
Long-range mind influence is rare and institutionally banned
Navigational auguries exist but cannot replace charts and seamanship
Ritual magic consumes scarce imported reagents or specialized labor
Combustion-derived industry limited; no high-pressure steam megatechs
Coastal-state logistics dependent on secure port access and reagent supply
notes: Ports and Maritime Guild control access to imported reagents critical for major rituals
Harbor District is strategic chokepoint for economy and defense
Tide-Temple rituals tied to seasonal navigation windows; disruption causes trade/morale shocks
Membership in A3 constrains independent privateering policy
